channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road Flooded, 8th February
item.description:
The road is flooded at the Ham Brook Bridge. The culverts under the road are at maximum level. Our flood defences at Brook House are coping for now and helping to drain the road but may not for much longer
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars ignoring red light and driving through pedestrian crossing on green, 8th February
item.description:
Cars are routinely jumping the red light at this junction, to such an extent that they are driving through the pedestrian crossing when the green light for pedestrians is showing. I walked home at about 5.15pm today and as I was about to cross two cars drove straight through when the light was green for pedestrians. If I was blind and relying on the crossing sound I would have been knocked over. Please either extend the time between red for cars and green for pedestrians, or install a red light camera to stop drivers jumping the lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thirlestaine Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of fallen/cut branches in water course, 8th February
item.description:
On the Gretton Road where the Sabrina Way heads towards Woolstone Hill Farm, the water course, only yards from the road is full of fallen/cut tree branches in the water course way that could lead to localised flooding.

item.title: Bin has not been emptied for 20 days, 8th February
item.description:
